skillTree.localised_description: A gift from Khaine, containing the secret of eternal youth and beauty. His brides may bathe in it to renew their vitality.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: "Now let us drink from the crimson cup so that our lord's desires may be our desires, his appetites our appetites, his thirst our thirst. Let us glory in the destruction we create in his name. Praise be to Khaine!"

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +20% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Malida is armed with enchanted weaponry coated in eternally dripping, poisoned blood.
This magic armour is a gift from Khaine, stained with the blood of countless enemies who have been brutally sacrificed to the Lord of Murder.

effects.description:
Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: "Why stop at one, when you can have two?"

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: With enough sacrifices, the deepest secrets of the Cauldron of Blood will be yours.
Deep devotion to the Bloody-handed God have led to his favour, enabling her to withstand more punishment in melee than others.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%

Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Malida is one of the youngest Witch Elves ever to have risen to the status of Hag Queen. In battle her thirst for blood has made her one of the deadliest servants of the Witch King, for she wishes to become the greatest of the Hag Queens ever to have ruled over the Sisterhood.

effects.description:
Attribute: Causes Fear for Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Whether Elf, Dwarf, or man, their souls now serve the pleasure of the Blood Queen.
Malida dances swiftly in battle, slaughtering all enemies trying to approach with her relentless blades.
"Praise be to Khaine!"

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Death Hags
	(local province)

Melee attack: +5 for embedded Death Hag Heroes
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for embedded Death Hag Heroes
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 5% for embedded Death Hag Heroes
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the city of Karond Kar, Dark Elves can pay witness to a bloody spectacle that fills them with elation and fear in equal measure, as the Harpies soar upon the thermals of the sacrificial pyres. Some Dark Elves believe they are the souls of slain witch elves, others that they are a manifestation of Khaine's wrath.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +10 for Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Expendable for Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

skillTree.localised_description: "A God named Khaine, a God of murder and death and bloodshed, only the willfully blind could not see that this is none other than the Blood Lord himself, cloaked in one of his many guises to beguile and trick those who might otherwise repel him."

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25% for Harpies and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -25% for Harpies and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +3 for Harpies and Witch Elves units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
Where the Blood Queen treads, murder follows in her wake.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Magic is a most useful tool on the field of battle, but generally secondary in the face of good, old-fashioned brute force.

skillTree.localised_description: The most effective raiders have a plan that is certain to succeed and stick to it; this one ensures that they do.

skillTree.localised_description: An elite even amongst elites, this accomplished warrior directs the cut-and-thrust of melee - a choreographer of death, you might say.

skillTree.localised_description: The murderous, unforgiving rage of Khaine can be transferred from a Lord to his legions.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
"Blood poured down the battlements. Iron spikes with impaled corpses, decorated the ramparts of this dark, forbidden place and above them flew Harpies, bloated with raw flesh."

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: -5% for enemy armies starting their turn in this region
	(enemy armies in local province)

Campaign movement range: -10% for enemy armies starting their turn in this region
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Karond Kar, also known as the Tower of Despair, can be counted the bleakest of all refuges. The citadel stands sentinel on the edge of the Sea of Chill, perpetually battered by gale-force winds, icy rain, and tidal waves the size of mountains. It is here that the great reaving fleets bring their living cargo.

items.colour_text: "Now let us drink from the crimson cup so that our lord's desires may be our desires, his appetites our appetites, his thirst our thirst."

This magic armour is a gift from Khaine, stained with the blood of countless enemies who have been sacrificed to the Lord of Murder.

backgroundSkills.localised_name: Deadliest Servant of the Witch King
backgroundSkills.localised_description: Malida is an ancient Hag Queen, the mistress of all the Witch Elves of Karond Kar. As one of the youngest servants of Khaine to rise to that position, her bloodlust is legendary among the Sisterhood and her twin blades eternally thirst for further conquests.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Witch Elves units and embedded Death Hag Heroes
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +5 for Witch Elves units and embedded Death Hag Heroes
	(Lord's army)
